image.altText: two hands grasping prison bars

props.synopsis: Children as young as 14 years old could spend life in prison for some violent crimes after the Victorian parliament passed a controversial bill on Thursday. So what are the changes?

title.children: 'Adult Time for Violent Crime' laws pass Victorian parliament

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says a targeted search has focused on locating evidence or the body of fugitive Dezi Freeman, four months after he allegedly fatally shot two police officers in Porepunkah, in north-east Victoria.

title.children: Breaking: Latest Dezi Freeman search focused on finding 'body'

image.altText: A blue and white Victoria Police sign outside a building.

props.synopsis: A Victorian lawyer says a "crisis" is unfolding in the state's jails, with remand centres so crowded prisoners are instead being kept in police holding cells for up to a month.

title.children: Victorian prisoners held in police stations for weeks, lawyer says

image.altText: Brodie wearing a netball shirt and holding a netball

props.synopsis: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

title.children: This 18-year-old is the first badged netball umpire in a wheelchair

image.altText: David sits on a chair and looks at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Elderly residents in Melbourne's south-east say they are in financial distress after two rent increases, which a community housing organisation says are a necessary move to a standard rent-setting model.

title.children: Pensioners handed consecutive rent rises after new provider takes over

image.altText: A close up photo of Jaclyn Symes with a red background

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jaclyn Symes says the state's public service has become "top-heavy" with "too many executives", as her government unveils measures to save $4 billion over the next four years.

title.children: Victorian government targets executives as 1,000 public sector jobs cut

image.altText: Temporary fencing stands in front of a damaged building with plywood sheets nailed up on the facade.

props.synopsis: Leaders of international Jewish communities have walked through the debris of an Melbourne synagogue a year after it was firebombed as two accused men faced court.

title.children: Jewish leaders attend Melbourne synagogue for anniversary of firebombing

image.altText: The back of a man with grey hair being escorted by uniformed police.

props.synopsis: An international drug kingpin once described as "Asia's El Chapo" is sentenced after an "unusual" deal between a former Australian attorney-general and Dutch authorities.

title.children: Global drug syndicate leader sentenced after 'unusual' deal struck

image.altText: bushfire

props.synopsis: Some parts of the state hit 38 degrees Celsius as emergency services manage the risk of bushfire in regional Victoria.

title.children: Bushfires flare, air tanker crashes as temperatures soar in Victoria

image.altText: A man smiles in a photo with coworkers

props.synopsis: Detectives have issued an additional 83 charges against Joshua Dale Brown, a former childcare worker who was charged with more than 70 offences earlier this year.

title.children: Alleged childcare paedophile Joshua Brown hit with further charges

image.altText: Australian, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags flying in front of buildings

props.synopsis: A mayor in southern NSW says removing the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags from council meeting chambers will "promote civic neutrality".

title.children: NSW council votes to stop flying Indigenous flags to 'promote civic neutrality'

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police won't pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: A For Lease sign advertising a rental property in Carlton North.

props.synopsis: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

title.children: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs

image.altText: A girl holds three tennis balls of increasing size. She is smiling and wearing reflective blue and green sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Victorian teenager Maddy Kelly was 11 years old when she started losing her sight. Two years later, she's a national tennis champion.

title.children: Teen who lost sight at 11 becomes national tennis champion

image.altText: A building with a maroon sign that says "Keysborough College" and purple and white vertical signs, one saying "respect".

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old teacher accused of stabbing a principal at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Tuesday "snapped" after learning his contract would not be renewed, a court has heard.

title.children: Teacher 'snapped' over contract before stabbing principal, court hears

image.altText: Towers at an oil refinery.

props.synopsis: With just two refineries left and 80 per cent of liquid fuel being imported, experts are warning Australia is increasingly vulnerable to global supply shocks.

title.children: Fuel security warning as Australia's oil reserves fall short of global standards

image.altText: The outside of a court building, with a bicycle parked near the entrance

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian footballer and youth worker are facing drug trafficking charges after being caught with a package allegedly containing illegal drugs.

title.children: Footballer and youth worker charged after police drug drop sting

image.altText: A weatherboard house behind a Colorbond fence in a country area.

props.synopsis: A woman on trial for the alleged murder of 72-year-old Victorian man John Hunter tells the Supreme Court she was present when he was attacked but another person was responsible for his death.

title.children: Woman tells court she witnessed beating but did not kill 72yo

image.altText: A line of caravans behind a security fence in a depot.

props.synopsis: Zone RV is just one in a series of caravan companies that have gone under in recent years. Here are the major challenges plaguing the industry.

title.children: Why are so many Australian caravan companies collapsing?

image.altText: Alex and Vicky Ryvchin outside former Dover Heights home after it was vandalised, red paint on white wall

props.synopsis: Executive Council of Australian Jewry Alex Ryvchin said the data showed antisemitism remained at "deeply troubling levels".

title.children: Report details attacks and abuse faced by Australian Jews

image.altText: A man wearing a black leather jacket and black head covering stands in front of a stone wall with a motorcycle attached to it.

props.synopsis: Motorcyclists in regional SA and south-west Victoria say pothole-riddled regional roads are taking a physical, mental and financial toll on riders.

title.children: Fed up motorcyclists call for dangerous potholes littering highways to be fixed

image.altText: Ryan Cho wears sunglasses and a surgical mask as he walks down the street. A reporter holds a microphone towards him.

props.synopsis: A trainee surgeon accused of secretly filming women in hospital toilets and bathroom is facing hundreds of additional charges.

title.children: Doctor handed hundreds of additional illegal hospital recording charges

image.altText: A smiling woman and man, both with dark hair, stand on a wooden stairway in a house.

props.synopsis: Staff used vile and derogatory terms to describe people dealing with the collapse of their builder, according to a Victorian Ombudsman's report.

title.children: State insurer exacerbated stress of Victorian homeowners, damning report finds

image.altText: A main street in Camberwell showing pedestrians, cars and a tram.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government vows to overhaul "outdated" car parking requirements for new residential developments in areas that are well-serviced by public transport.

title.children: Allan government targets car parking rules in bid to build more homes

image.altText: a render of people in a stadium

props.synopsis: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after independents Casey Hiscutt, Bec Thomas and Tania Rattray declared they would support the contentious project.

title.children: A vote to approve an AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront will now pass

image.altText: Dr Ash Gordon wears a white collared shirt and blue blazer and smiles in front of a cream brick wall.

props.synopsis: Ashley Gordon grew up in the Victorian coal mining town of Morwell and went on to become a doctor before he was murdered.

title.children: Man sentenced to 17 years in jail for murder of Melbourne doctor

image.altText: A Rugby League player with long hair yells in triumph.

props.synopsis: Former Melbourne fullback Ryan Papenhuyzen says his future is a "blank canvas" ahead of a break from professional sport that he admits could end up being permanent.

title.children: Papenhuyzen unsure if he'll ever play pro sport again after Storm exit

image.altText: Image of a man standing with arms crossed out the front of a hotel.

props.synopsis: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

title.children: Dicky Bill farm workers scrambling for jobs after sudden shutdown

image.altText: A young girl puts on make up in a mirror

props.synopsis: Hayley masks their struggles so well in dance class that teachers can't tell. But when they get home, they collapse — sometimes missing days of school.

title.children: Meet the teen who masks their way through class then collapses at home

image.altText: Two young primary school girls working together in a classroom

props.synopsis: Parents can check the latest NAPLAN scores for 10,000 schools across the country on the MySchool website.

title.children: The 'secret sauce' powering schools punching above their weight in NAPLAN

image.altText: A man with a grey beard wearing a beanie

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old Victorian man who died while cave diving in South Australia's south-east has been described as "fastidious" and as having a dark sense of humour, as an internal investigation is launched into what led to his death.

title.children: Cave diver Gary Gibson remembered as investigation begins into death

image.altText: Hills of grey dust at a mining facility

props.synopsis: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

title.children: Authorities install air monitors near Ballarat Goldmine amid dust concerns

image.altText: On an overcast day, you view a y-shaped public housing tower with an open-air carpark surrounding it.

props.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry has called on the government to halt the demolition of Melbourne's public housing towers after finding it refused to provide evidence to justify the plan.

title.children: Inquiry calls for Melbourne public housing towers demolition to stop

image.altText: A man wearing a blue suit jacket and open-necked shirt.

props.synopsis: After facing AFL premiership players in court, a former player agent is fined $4,500 for selling fraudulent memorabilia from the 2021 grand final.

title.children: Ex-AFL agent guilty of selling fake footy memorabilia

image.altText: Close-up shot of Scales of Justice statue in Brisbane CBD on August 1, 2018.

props.synopsis: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

title.children: Threats against Victorian judges, magistrates by sovereign citizens double
